alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 8:06PM EDT until March 25 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. .Recent rainfall will cause continued minor rises in the Tiffin River at Stryker into mid week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tiffin River at Stryker. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Portions of State Route 66 flood north of Archbold. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening, reaching a a crest of 11.8 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
